metadata.title: CVE-2020-21913 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
International Components for Unicode (ICU-20850) v66.1 was discovered tocontain a use after free bug in the pkg_createWithAssemblyCode function inthe file tools/pkgdata/pkgdata.cpp.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-21913` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libicu52 - 52.1-3ubuntu0.8+esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: firefox: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
icu package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '52.1-3ubuntu0.8+esm2').
